translations.searchSlogan: Search for information on research in Finland
translations.searchTooltip: You can search for publications, researchers, funding decisions, research data, funding calls, infrastructures and organizations.
translations.searchPlaceholder: For example, publication, field of science, keyword
translations.searchHelp1: In the search field, enter the name of the publication, keyword, project name or, for example, the name of the organization.
translations.searchHelp2: You can filter search results after searching in the search view.
translations.searchHelp3: The search targets publications, researchers, projects, research data, funding calls, infrastructures, and organizations.
translations.searchSuggest1: Please enter at least 3 letters for suggestions
translations.resultInfo2: information is included in the service?
translations.fundingCallsIncluded: Which funding calls are included in the service?
translations.newsServiceIncludes: news are included in the service?
translations.maxResults2: If the result you were looking for was not found, try refining your search.
translations.orgAndAuthorsTooltip: Publication authors with a Finnish organization.
translations.noPublicationLinks: There are no links to the publication on this service
translations.relatedPublications: Search for items related to the publication
translations.doiHelp: Publication must have a DOI to retrieve attributes
translations.citeDialogFooterText: Errors may occur in automatically generated references. Always check the reference details.
translations.publicationMediumTooltip: A journal, book publisher or series in which a publication appears.
translations.resultSearchTermWarning: Check your search term for spelling errors.{$LINE_BREAK} It may also be that the information you are looking for is not available in this online service.
translations.tooManyResultsNavigationDisabled: Too many results. Navigating to the end of search results is disabled.
translations.openScienceAndResearchIndicatorsHeader: Monitoring of open science and research
translations.academyConsortium: Role in consortium of the Academy of Finland
translations.noFundingLinks: Granted funding has no links available in this portal
translations.activeFiltersListHelp: You can remove filters from this list. The filter changes are also updated in the search results view.
translations.yearRangeWarning: Not all years are in the interval. You can check the years in the\ "Filters\" menu at the left.
translations.asPercentPublication: Percentage of the number of publications
translations.asPercentFunding: Percentage of the number of grants
translations.name: Name
translations.noOrganizationLinks: There are no links to the organization on this service
translations.publicationCountByFOS: Number of publications by field of science
translations.publicationCountByMajor: Number of publications by main field of science
translations.publicationCountByType: Number of publications by publication type
translations.publicationCountByCountry: Number of publications by publication country
translations.publicationCountByJuFo: Number of publications by publication forum level
translations.publicationCountByOA: Number of publications by open access
translations.fundingCountByType: Distribution of grants by funding instrument
translations.fundingCountByFOS: Distribution of grants by field of science
translations.acronymTooltip: Research infrastructure abbreviation. Infrastructures are typically known by their abbreviations.
translations.infraOrganizationTooltip: Organization responsible for the research infrastructure. Large infrastructures in particular may contain several services maintained by other organizations. Other organizations can view the infrastructure on the information page.
translations.noResultsWithTerm: No results with the search term
translations.noResultsInfo: The search term may contain a typographical error or its corresponding filter factor is not available in this section.
translations.filterCoPublicationsTooltip: By choosing the ”show only co-publications” you can see what publications are made as a collaboration between Finnish research organizations. The search results will show only those publications where the authors are from all of the organizations selected in the list below. If no organization is selected, the search result will show all co-publications.
translations.infraServicesTooltip: Research infrastructures in the research.fi service have one or more services. The services may be used by outside parties or intended only for the organization’s own research group. Because the service may also be offered by more than the responsible organization, it may have multiple service points.
translations.noInfraLinks: There are no links to the organization on this service
translations.showOnlyTKIfilter: Show only the RDI roadmap's follow up indicators
translations.figureKeyboardHelp1: For keyboard instructions, press" Shift +?\” while your browser's focus is in the visualization below.
translations.figureKeyboardHelp2: Keyboard help is displayed in the language specified in your browser's language setting.
translations.moreFiguresFrom: More figures from science and research
translations.skipToMain: Skip to the main page content
translations.portalLogoAltText: Research Information Hub portal logo, abstract window
translations.okmLogo: Ministry of Education and Culture logo, coat of arms - lion
translations.CSCLogoAltText: Organization CSC – IT Center for Science logo
translations.5339823294802549359: Non authorized to handle the request
translations.8402099562411461502: Server error. Serve responded with error while processing request
translations.cmsErrorContent1: Unfortunately we are unable to contact all parts of the system.
translations.cmsErrorContent2: A part of research.fi is temporarily out of order.
translations.cmsErrorContent3: You can continue to use the portal with limited information content.
translations.otherArticleTooltip: comprises articles not included in other categories.
translations.dataArticleTooltip: contains the articles that describe research data and that have been published in data journals.
translations.reviewArticleTooltip: is based on earlier publications on the same topic.
translations.originalArticleTooltip: is a scientific article that mainly consists of previously unpublished material.
translations.articleTooltipContent: Includes original and review articles, introductions and forewords of a book or journal, short research reports, editorials, contributions to a debate and comments.
translations.monographTooltipContent: Includes monographs/books, development or research reports based on R&D efforts, assessments, white papers, working papers and discussion papers.
translations.editorialTooltipContent: Includes editorial work in research books or special issues of journals consisting of various articles by several authors.
translations.abstractTooltipContent: Includes abstracts and extended abstracts of conference presentations.
translations.blogTooltipContent: Contains blog publications that have been approved for publication by an independent editorial board or that are published on a platform assigned an ISSN number.
translations.journalTooltipContent: Includes scientific journals and professional journals.
translations.researchBookTooltipContent: Includes scientific research books, scientific yearbooks and similar publications, professional manuals or guides, professional information systems or research books, textbook materials, and short encyclopedia texts.
translations.ConferenceTooltipContent: Includes the printed publications and other openly accessible publications of the conference, the so-called proceedings.
translations.scientificPublicationTooltipContent: Publications intended to promote science and to produce new information.
translations.professionalPublicationTooltipContent: Publications disseminating information on research and development for a professional community.
translations.popularPublicationTooltipContent: Publications disseminating information on research and development for the public and the content of which does not require particular familiarity with the field.
translations.peerReviewedTooltip: The peer review of scientific publications refers to a procedure by which a journal, conference or publishing house publishing research results requests that experts in the field of science carry out a preliminary evaluation of the scientific fitness for publication of manuscripts intended for publication.
translations.publicationAuthorsTooltip: Publication authors in the order they are listed in the original publication. If there are more than 20 authors, not all of them will necessarily be mentioned.
translations.publisherOpenAccess: Open access in the publisher’s service
translations.embargoDate: Date when the embargo on self-archived document expires
translations.apcPaymentYear: Year of payment for the open publication fee
translations.publicationChannelType: The publication’s publication channel’s type of open access.
translations.OaFullyOpenTooltipContent: All publications are immediately and permanently accessible in the publisher’s service.
translations.OaPartiallyOpenTooltipContent: Some of the publications (such as hybrid journals) are immediately and permanently accessible in the publisher’s service.
translations.OaDelayedTooltipContent: Access to at least some of the publications remains blocked until the expiry of the embargo specified by the publisher.
translations.pubLicenseTooltip: License details of the publication accessible in the publisher’s service.
translations.selfArchivedTooltip: Openly accessible self-archived version of the publication is kept in the publication archive of the relevant organization or field of science.
translations.selfLicenseTooltip: License details of the self-archived publication kept in the publication archive of the relevant organization or field of science.
translations.publisherVersionTooltip: The article published in the publisher’s service.
translations.finalDraftTooltip: The final (peer-reviewed) draft sent to the publisher and approved for publication.
translations.apcTooltip: The fee paid for making the publication open access (in euros).
translations.apcJointPublication: In joint publications, the publication fee may be paid by one or more organizations participating in the publication. The actual fee may be higher if there are payments that have not been reported.
translations.okmDataCollection: The publication is included in the Ministry of Education and Culture’s Publication data collection
translations.okmDataCollectionShort: Included in the Ministry of Education and Culture’s Publication data collection
translations.okmDataCollectionTooltip: The publication data collected by the Ministry of Education and Culture is contained in the publications reported to the Ministry each year by higher education institutions, research institutes and university hospitals that meet the criteria for the publication data collection and that are considered in the higher education institutions’ funding model.
translations.onlinePlatformTooltipContent: Contains publications published on other online platforms.
translations.6237827988468109472: Publication channel’s identifier at Publication Forum (www.julkaisufoorumi.fi/en).
translations.8722392264873780327: The publication has been published in a publication channel, whose publications are all openly available.
translations.7842221493969044364: The publication has been published in a publication archive specific to an organization or field of science either immediately or after a reasonable embargo period set by the publisher.
translations.delayedOpenAccessInfo: Scientific articles are opened only after an embargo time defined by the publisher. This category contains both publications that are already openly available and those that are still behind a paywall.
translations.1467910369543476416: The publication is openly available, but appears in a hybrid publication channel whose publications are not all openly available.
translations.nonOpenAccessInfo: The publication has not appeared in an open publication channel, nor is the publication available as an open self-archived version. NB. also publications that are temporarily openly available, for example, due to a current socially significant topic or a publisher's marketing campaign, will be visible through this category.
translations.noOpenAccessDataInfo: The open availability status of the publication has not been reported.
translations.intCoPublicationAuthors: The publication includes authors from organizations outside of Finland
translations.publicationCompanyAuthors: The publication includes authors from at least one company.
translations.sfDescriptionTooltip: Concise description of the grant objective
translations.sfStartYearTooltip: Year for which funding was granted. In funding covering several years, the first year of funding.
translations.sfEndYearTooltip: Ending year of funding. In the group of multiple decisions, the ending year of the latest decision.
translations.sfTypeOfFundingTooltip: Method of funding research. Instruments of funding include research grants, project funding and research infrastructure funding. Instruments are often specific to each funder.
translations.fundingCountByIdentifiedTopic: Division of projects by identified topic
translations.identifiedTopicsTooltip: Comprehensive topic categorisation, spanning all grants in the Hub, is formed with the help of machine learning. Then each grant is assigned the topic it most likely addresses. There is not enough information on all grants to identify the topic.
translations.fieldOfScienceTooltip: The Statistics Finland’s Fields of science classification. One grant may involve multiple fields of science. Not all funders use fields of science.
translations.fieldsOfResearchTooltip: Research Council of Finland categorizes grants also according to its own research fields.
translations.fkeywordsTooltip: Limit search based on the keywords in the grant information.
translations.fthemesTooltip: Some funders organize calls according to themes. Themes are typically funder specific causing results to show only grants funded by one funder.
translations.fresearchFieldTooltip: The Research Council of Finland categorizes also grants according to its own research fields. The filter applies only to funding granted by the Research Council of Finland.
translations.sfCallProgrammeTooltip: Funder's call granting the funding. Competed research funding is often granted through open calls, in which funding is granted on the basis of prescribed criteria. Applications are evaluated and funding is granted to the best applicants based on this criteria and other objectives.
translations.relatedFundingTooltip: Other decisions related to this funding decision, e.g. granted funding for research costs. Includes information on the related decision’s identifier, funding method, starting year, and the amount of funding granted.
translations.4073996987769162370: The funding recipient may be a person or organization. In many cases, the specified funding recipient is a principal investigator (PI), who will not personally be using the funding as it will instead be used to cover project costs.
translations.fundingAmountTooltip: The total amount granted by the funder. The amount does not include all project costs. The organization in which the project is carried out may fund a certain part of it (i.e. self-financing contribution) and the project may also have other funders.
translations.singleFundingFunderTooltip: Researcher funders which have granted funding. All research funders submitting information to the research.fi-service are listed in the Organizations section.
translations.1565148669960905628: A website outside the research.fi service that contains more detailed information on the grant.
translations.datasetBetaInfo: Research data is a new section in Research.fi -portal. The source for the section's metadata are the Fairdata.fi -services. For this new section in Research.fi, all feedback is welcome and should be sent to tiedejatutkimus@csc.fi
translations.datasetAuthorsTooltip: The persons and organizations involved in the research or the production of research data.
translations.datasetProjectTooltip: The project in which the data was created.
translations.datasetLicenseTooltip: The license specifying the terms and conditions for the use of the data.
translations.datasetTemporalCoverageTooltip: The period of time covered by the data (e.g. the period in which the observations were made).
translations.datasetAccessPermitTooltip: Accessing the data requires applying for a permit in the Fairdata service.
translations.datasetAccessLoginTooltip: Accessing the data requires logging in to the Fairdata service.
translations.datasetAccessRestrictedTooltip: Access to the data is restricted. For more detailed information about the restriction, see the data source.
translations.datasetAccessEmbargoTooltip: An embargo, or publication delay, determines when the data will be made available.
translations.noDatasetLinks: There are no links to the research data on this portal
translations.relatedDatasets: Search for items related to the research data
translations.datasetOrgFilterTooltip: The organizations involved in the research or the production of research data. Currently, the service does not contain any information on foreign organizations involved in the research data. Information on organizations is not combined with datasets in all cases. We aim to improve links between datasets and organizations.
translations.datasetFieldFilterTooltip: The Statistics Finland Fields of science classification.
translations.datasetLangFilterTooltip: The language used in the data.
translations.finlandRoadmapTooltip: The research infrastructure is included in the current Academy of Finland roadmap for national infrastructures in Finland 2021–2024.
translations.infraDescriptionTooltip: The description provides general information on the research infrastructure.
translations.scientificDescriptionTooltip: It explains the scientific applications and intended use of the research infrastructure.
translations.infraStartYearTooltip: The year that the entire research infrastructure was launched. If the starting year is unknown, the year when information was submitted to the research.fi service is to be used
translations.responsibleOrganizationTooltip: The home organization of the research infrastructure which is responsible for its entirety. Infrastructures may also contain other organizations that are responsible for some of its services.
translations.infraKeywordsTooltip: Keywords describing the research infrastructure, its services and activities.
translations.serviceDescriptionTooltip: More detailed description of the service.
translations.serviceTypeTooltip: Research infrastructure services are divided into three different types: data, equipment or service. The selected type best describes the service.
translations.8305960712658584084: On the Academy of Finland roadmap
translations.contactInfoTooltip: It provides the service contact information and specifies any terms of use. Service point may be described in greater detail. In some cases, the service may differ from one service point to another, such as with regard to the available equipment
translations.orgStaffCount: Number of teaching and research staff (py)
translations.fintoSource: Source: Finto - thesaurus and ontology service www.finto.fi
translations.vipunenSource: Source: Vipunen - Education Statistics Finland www.vipunen.fi
translations.howToDeliverFcInstructions: How to send open funding calls to Research.fi
translations.fundingCallPeriodTooltip: The period when the funding call is open. You can filter the application periods by the start date, end date or year of the funding call.
translations.fundingCallCategoryTooltip: The categories specified in the Aurora Funding Database for Science and Arts are largely based on the fields of science classification
translations.fundingCallFunderTooltip: The research funder responsible for the funding call.
translations.pOrgFTooltip: Finnish organization of the publication’s author. The service currently does not contain any information on publications’ foreign organizations.
translations.pFOSFTooltip: The Statistics Finland Fields of science classification. Fields of Art according to Ministry of Education and Culture Publication data collection. A publication may include 1-6 fields of science or art.
translations.pTypeFTooltip: Publication type A-G categories according to Ministry of Education and Culture Publication data collection.
translations.pCountryFTooltip: The publisher of the domestic publication is Finnish or it is primarily published in Finland. The publisher of the international publication is not Finnish or it is primarily published elsewhere than in Finland.
translations.pLangFTooltip: Language in which the publication is written.
translations.pJufoFTooltip: Publication Forum (www.julkaisufoorumi.fi) classification of publication channels (book publisher, conference or book series): 1 = basic level, 2 = leading level, 3 = highest level. Category 0 is for publication channels that have been evaluated but do not meet all of the level 1 criteria. The publication forum classification level is determined by the publication year of the publication.
translations.intCoPublicationTooltip: Some of the publication’s authors come from research organizations outside of Finland.
translations.fYearFTooltip: Year for which funding was granted. In funding covering several years, the first year of funding.
translations.fOrgFTooltip: Organization in which the beneficiary works or to which the funding is granted.
translations.fFunderFTooltip: Research funder granting the funding. Only funders which have submitted information to the service are listed.
translations.fTypeOfFundingTooltip: Method of funding research. Funding instruments include research grants, project funding and research infrastructure funding. The funding instruments are grouped by funder in the filter, because they are often funder-specific.
translations.fFieldsOfScienceTooltip: The Statistics Finland’s Fields of science classification. One grant may involve multiple fields of science. Not all funders use fields of science. As a result, filters cannot be used to determine the share of total funding for a given field of science.
translations.personsOrgTooltip: Primary affiliation chosen by the researcher. At the moment does not contain information about foreign organizations and in some cases the organizational information of the researcher has not been connected to the domestic organization.
translations.funderTopicTooltip: Filters that categorize grant topics. In general, categories are not comprehensive and may be specific for individual funder.
translations.iYearFTooltip: The starting year of the research infrastructure. If the starting year is unknown, the year when information was submitted to research.fi is to be used.
translations.org1Tooltip: The 13 universities specified in the Universities Act and the Finnish National Defence University submit information to the research.fi service.
translations.org2Tooltip: The 22 universities of applied sciences administered by the Ministry of Education and Culture and the Police University College submit information to the research.fi service.
translations.org3Tooltip: Research institutions under different administrative branches which have submitted information to the research.fi service.
translations.org4Tooltip: Finland has five catchment areas for university hospitals laid down in the Decree. All of these submit their publication information to the research.fi service.
translations.org5Tooltip: Research funders, which have submitted information on their funding decisions to the research.fi service.
translations.org6Tooltip: Other organizations active in the field of research which do not fall into the categories above.
translations.author: Author
translations.publicationsTooltip: Publications from Finnish universities, universities of applied sciences, research institutes and university hospitals.
translations.authorsTooltip: Researchers and research experts related to Finnish research.
translations.fundingsTooltip: Funding decisions issued by Finnish public and private research funders starting from the date each funder joined the service. Funding decisions issued to Finnish organizations by the EU starting from the Horizon 2020 framework program.
translations.fundingCallsTooltip: Open and upcoming funding calls for science, art and culture by the Finnish foundations.
translations.infrastructuresTooltip: Research infrastructures maintained in Finland. Infrastructures are single-sited, distributed or virtual instruments, equipment, data networks, databases, data and services which facilitate the conducting of research.
translations.organizationsTooltip: Information for research.fi is submitted by research organizations and funders.
translations.leaveReviewHeader: Give feedback or ask a question
translations.r1: Use this form to provide feedback on the tiedejatutkimus.fi online service. All feedback and questions are welcome! You can also send your feedback or question by e-mail to tiedejatutkimus@csc.fi{$LINE_BREAK} {$START_LINK}Privacy statement{$CLOSE_LINK}
translations.r2: Please give us feedback or ask a question!
translations.r3: I want to give feedback on *
translations.r5: Enter your feedback in the field above.
translations.r6: Location of the feedback in the service
translations.r9: Which section does your feedback apply to?
translations.r10: For example, general feedback, page title, URL
translations.feedbackContact: I would like to be contacted regarding my feedback
translations.r13: Select this if you would like us to contact you
translations.ur4: Location of the feedback in the service
translations.ur6: I have checked the information I entered
translations.ur7: Select when you have verified that the information above is correct.
translations.ur8: Confirmation that the person giving feedback is not a robot
translations.feedbackSuccess: We have recieved your feedback. Thank you!
translations.resultCountAriaLabel: Number of results on single page
translations.startManagingYourProfile: You can start managing your profile on Researcher's Profile Tool.
translations.openTermsAndProcessingPrinciples: Open the terms of use and processing principles
translations.deploymentAbort: The deployment will be aborted and no data will be saved.
translations.yesCancelDeployment: Yes, I want to cancel the deployment
translations.noContinueDeployment: No, I will continue the deployment
translations.termsPersonalDataProcessing: Terms of use and processing of personal data
translations.termsForTool: Terms of use for the Researcher’s Profile Tool
translations.iHaveReadTermsAndAccept: I have read and agree to the terms of use for the service
translations.iAcceptProcessingPersonalData: I hereby agree to the processing of my personal data
translations.homeWelcomeCaption: Compile a public profile of your data in the Research.fi service
translations.homeWelcomeText: Using the Researcher's Profile Tool, you can compile a public profile in the Research.fi service from information in your ORCID profile and your home organisation. In the tool, you can preview the information before it is published and select only the information that you want to be part of your profile.
translations.updatedProfilePublishedAt: By clicking "Publish", the information you have chosen will be published in the Research.fi service.
translations.updatingPublicDataTakesFewMinutes: It may take a few minutes for the information to update.
translations.deleteProfileConnProblem: Connection issue. Deleting the profile failed. Try it again in a while.
translations.hideProfileModalTitle: Do you want to hide your profile?
translations.deleteProfileModalTitle: Do you want to delete your profile?
translations.connectionProblemDeleteProfile: Connection issue. Deleting the profile failed. Try it again in a while.
translations.connectionProblemHideProfile: Connection issue. Hiding the profile failed. Try it again in a while.
translations.youHaveNotSelectedAnyPublicData: You have not yet selected the information to be displayed publicly
translations.selectInformationToDisplayInProfile: Select the information to display in your profile
translations.primaryInfoWillAppearFirst: The primary information will appear first on the list in your profile.
translations.profilePublishedToast: Profile published successfully. The information will be available on the Research.fi service in a few minutes.
translations.profileHiddenToast: Hiding the profile was successful. Your profile will be hidden from the Research.fi service in a few minutes.
translations.title: Title
translations.searchForMissingDataset: Searching for a missing research data
translations.searchForPublicationWithName: Search for a publication under the name of the author or publication
translations.searchForDatasetWithName: Search for research data under the name of the author or organization
translations.searchForFundingWithName: Search for a project with project name or principal investigator name
translations.dataSourceIsResearchFi: The Research.fi service is used as a source of information
translations.discardSessionChanges: Do you want to discard all unsaved changes?
translations.sessionExpiredLogin: Session has expired. Log in to continue.
translations.youHaveUnpublishedChangesContinue: You have unpublished changes. If you log out, the changes will be lost.
translations.youHaveUnpublishedChangesSnackbar: You have unpublished changes in the profile view.
translations.suomiFiAutheticationProblemSnackbarText: Some users have experienced an error following Suomi.fi authentication. The error prevents access to the profile tool. In case the error occurs, the user can continue the login process by clicking "Log in" on top of the page.
translations.welcomeStepperHowItWorksCaption: How does the Researcher's Profile Tool work?
translations.welcomeStepperStep1Caption: Begin using the tool with strong Suomi.fi identification and log in with your ORCID account.
translations.welcomeStepperStep2Caption: Compile the information displayed on your public profile.
translations.welcomeStepperStep3Caption: When you update your information in ORCID or your home organisation, the information you select in your profile will also be updated automatically.
translations.welcomeStepperStep4Caption: Preview the information you've added to your public profile before publishing it.
translations.welcomeStepperStep5Caption: Share your profile information with other research actors.
translations.welcomeStepperStep2Content1: Once you have logged in, you can choose which information associated with your ORCID iD you want to make public on your profile. In addition to the information found in ORCID, you can attach information from your home organisation to your profile. All you have to do is select the information you want to make public. It is not possible to enter information to the tool on your own.
translations.welcomeStepperStep2Content2: If you cannot find information from your current home organisation, it is because your organisation has not yet made the necessary data transfers.
translations.welcomeStepperStep3Content1: If you want to edit your original data, you must do so in the original source (home organisation system, ORCID service). Information is automatically updated in your profile.
translations.welcomeStepperStep4Content: Once you have selected the information you want, you can preview your profile in the Edit view. The information on the profile be visible in the Research.fi portal after you have published it.
translations.welcomeStepperStep5Content: During 2023, we will develop functionality for sharing your profile information with research funders, your home organisation and other partners who are prepared to utilise the information in their own systems. This is not yet possible in the current version.
translations.welcomeStepperStep6Content: Your profile is now available on the Research.fi website, where, for example, the media, funders, those interested in research cooperation and other research information seekers can find it.
translations.accountSettingsOrcidInfo: This setting will automatically add new information that you have added to the ORCID service or that has been associated with your ORCID ID in your Research.fi public profile.
translations.accountSettingsOrcidModalTextEnable: This setting will automatically add new information that you have added to the ORCID service or that has been associated with your ORCID iD in your home organization to your Research.fi public profile.
translations.accountSettingsOrcidModalTextDisable: New information that you have added to the ORCID service or is associated to your Orcid ID in your home organisation will no longer automatically update to your public profile on Research.fi.
translations.accountSettingsProfileRemovalInfo: Deleting profile means deleting your public profile along with the data you imported from ORCID. Information stored in the profile tool during login will also be deleted.
translations.accountSettingsProfileRemovalModalText: Deleting profile means deleting your public profile along with the data you imported from ORCID. Information stored in the profile tool during login will also be deleted.
translations.accountSettingsHideAccountInfo: Hiding your public profile means that it is hidden in the Research.fi service. You can still log in and re-publish your profile.
translations.accountSettingsHideAccountModalText: Hiding your public profile means that it is hidden in the Research.fi service. You can still log in and re-publish your profile.
translations.orcidDataFetchInfo1: To enable the Researcher’s Profile Tool, you must save the public information you have stored in ORCID to the Researcher’s Profile Tool.
translations.orcidDataFetchInfo2: Select "Import my ORCID data” to authorise saving your public information stored in ORCID in the Researcher’s Profile Tool.
translations.orcidDataFetchInfo3: At this point, we will not yet publish your profile.
translations.orcidDataFetchInfo4: You can manage the display of your information in the profile tool.
translations.myDataEditorModalPublicationTabInfo: Publications found in the Research.fi service that include your ORCID iD are automatically added to your information. Publications not linked to your ORCID iD can be added using the “Search for other publications” feature.
translations.myDataEditorModalPublicationChooseItems: You can select publications for your profile from the list below.
translations.myDataEditorModalDatasetTabInfo: Research data with your ORCID iD in Research.fi are automatically added to your information. Datasets that are not associated with your ORCID iD can be added using the "Search for other research data" function.
translations.myDataEditorModalDatasetChooseItems: You can select research data for your profile from the list below.
translations.myDataEditorModalFundingTabInfo: Granted funding with your ORCID iD in Research.fi are automatically added to your information. Granted funding not associated with your ORCID iD can be added using the "Search for other granted funding" function.
translations.searchForOtherPublicationsFromPortal: Search for other publications in Research.fi with the name of the publication or author and attach them to your profile.
translations.searchForOtherDatasetsFromPortal: Search for other research data in Research.fi with the name of the material or author and attach them to your profile.
translations.searchForOtherFundingsFromPortal: Search for other granted fundings at Research.fi based on the information in the granted funding and attach them to your profile.
translations.myDataEditorModalActivityTabInfo: You can edit the data imported from ORCID in your ORCID profile. It may take up to 24 hours for the information to be updated. Data imported from your home organisation can only be edited in your home organisation's systems.
translations.actorRoleInActivity: Actor and role in the activity
translations.dataSourcesInformationTooltip: The information may be set to public in a Research.fi profile or hidden in a public profile.
translations.personsResultsInfoText_1: Researchers and other research experts associated with Finnish research can create their own profile in the Research.fi service using their ORCID iD, after which it is visible and searchable in the Researchers section of the Research.fi service.
translations.personsResultsInfoText_2: Profile is compiled with information transferred from home organisations and ORCID service and information already transferred to Research.fi.
translations.showDataToPublishInService: Set selected information to public in Research.fi service
translations.showDataToHideInService: Hide selected information from Research.fi service
translations.showDataToPublish: Show information about to be published

translations.authSuccessText1: Next, log in with your ORCID iD to import your research information into the service and connect it in the Researcher Profile Tool.
translations.authSuccessText2: Please note that if you do not have an ORCID account, which is required to create a profile, you can create one in
translations.logInToCreateProfile: Log in to create a profile or select the information that appears on your profile.
translations.mydata.profile.profile-is-hidden: You have hidden your profile from Research.fi service
translations.mydata.profile.republish-modal.title: Publish hidden profile
translations.mydata.account.text-for-hide: The profile you hide will be published again with information that you have previously selected to be public to Research.fi.
translations.mydata.account.hide-modal.title: Would you like to publish the profile you have hidden?
translations.mydata.account.hide-modal.text: The profile you hide will be published again with information that you have previously selected to be public to Research.fi.

translations.publicationClassA3: Book section, Chapters in research books

translations.publicationClassD4: Published development or research report or study

translations.publicationClassF2: Partial implementation of a work of art or performance

translations.publication2.openAccess.A.title: Open access:
translations.publication2.openAccess.A.description: The publication is openly available in the publisher's service.
translations.publication2.openAccess.B.title: Not open:
translations.publication2.openAccess.B.description: The publication is not openly available in the publisher's service.
translations.publication2.openAccess.C.title: Unknown:
translations.publication2.publisherOpenAccess.A.title: Fully open publication channel:
translations.publication2.publisherOpenAccess.A.descr: All publications are permanently openly available.
translations.publication2.publisherOpenAccess.B.title: Partially open publication channel:
translations.publication2.publisherOpenAccess.B.descr: Only some of the publications are permanently openly available.
translations.publication2.publisherOpenAccess.C.title: Delayed open publication channel:
translations.publication2.publisherOpenAccess.C.descr: Scientific articles are opened after a delay time defined by the publisher.
translations.publication2.publisherOpenAccess.D.title: No response:
translations.publication2.publisherOpenAccess.D.descr: The publication channel is not fully, partially, or delayed open.
translations.publication2.publisherOpenAccess.E.title: Unknown:
translations.publication2.selfArchived.A.title: Self-archived:
translations.publication2.selfArchived.A.description: The publication has been published in a publication archive specific to an organization or field of science either immediately or after a reasonable embargo period set by the publisher.
translations.publication2.toNewInfo: Test the beta version of the improved search. The improved search only works in publications. The information corresponds to the content of the current site for publications.
translations.publication2.toOldInfo: You are in the improved beta version of the search. You can go back to the whole site.
translations.publication2.tutorial.1: Test the beta version of the improved search function. The new search can currently only be tested in publication information retrieval.
translations.publication2.tutorial.2: Write in the search field, for example, the name of the publication or author, or a keyword related to the publication.
translations.publication2.tutorial.3: The search uses the OR search operator by default between words. If you wish, you can also use the AND and NOT search operators. For example, the search Innovation AND gamification NOT games search for publications that simultaneously contain the words “innovation” and “gamification”, but do not include the word “games”. Please note that the AND, NOT, and OR search operators must be written in capital letters in the search field.
translations.publication2.tutorial.4: By enclosing the phrases appearing in the search in quotation marks, you can search for matches exactly in the same form. For example, the phrase search "Innovations in gamifications" searches for publications that contain exactly this sentence. You can also combine several phrase searches with AND, OR, or NOT search operators.
translations.publication2.tutorial.5: You can also search for some metadata directly in the search field using commands defined separately for them. Phrase search must be used in the search. At the moment, the search can be targeted at the following metadata:
translations.publication2.tutorial.6: DOI, write in the search field doi:"searched identifier", for example, doi:"100100100"
translations.publication2.tutorial.7: ISSN, write in the search field issn:"searched identifier", for example, issn:"1234-1234"
translations.publication2.tutorial.8: ISBN, write in the search field isbn:"searched identifier", for example, isbn:"123-0-456-12345-1"
translations.publication2.tutorial.9: JUFO code, write in the search field jufoCode:"searched identifier", for example, jufoCode:"12345"
translations.publication2.tutorial.10: Please note that metadata fields must be written in lowercase in targeted search.
translations.publication2.contentInfo: What publication information is included in the service?
translations.fundingsDataDisclaimerLink: What information about granted funding does the service contain?
translations.fundingTypeTooltip: The method of funding describes for whom or for what purpose the funding is intended. In the first phase, information on the funding instrument will be provided by Research Council of Finland, it will be expanded to other funders open calls later.
translations.9195882976109410881: The year in which the funding was granted. In the first phase, information on the year of grant is provided by the Research Council of Finland. Information on the year of the grant will be extended to other funders at a later date.
translations.5534105236041691302: Scientific Council for Natural Sciences and Engineering
translations.4424042627869359759: Scientific Council for Biosciences, Health and the Environment
translations.9024376060582650262: Scientific Council for Social Sciences and Humanities
translations.6513753384822692310: Research Council of Finland's decision maker
translations.2700022207975886181: Funding for research conditions and environments / strategic funding
translations.7494934175116800135: Funding for research expenses for a postdoctoral researcher
translations.3171857755870970286: Research costs of Academy Research Fellows
translations.6676070322310995046: International research project of an Academy program
translations.6586146403315372170: Funding for activities of doctoral programmes
translations.4084349995542942299: Funding to strengthen universities' research profiles PROFI
translations.6890144111944813748: SRC matching funds for EU projects
translations.202707189569403758: International external funding project / Nordforsk-, Noria-Net-project
translations.7729094977625637676: The decision making body of Research Council of Finland that granted the funding.
translations.publication2.tutorial.91: Journal name, write in the search field journalName: "searched identifier", for example, journalName:"Nature"
translations.publication2.tutorial.92: Conference name, write in the search field conferenceName: "searched identifier", for example, conferenceName:"ACM Multimedia"
translations.publication2.tutorial.93: Publisher name, write in the search field publisherName: "searched identifier", for example, publisherName:"Springer"
translations.publication2.tutorial.51: With a wildcard ? you can replace one character of the search term. For example, if you want to search for the words "woman" and "women" at the same time, you can use the search term wom?n.
translations.publication2.tutorial.52: With a wildcard * you can replace one or more characters in the middle or at the end of the search term. The wildcard also represents a null character. For example, if you want to search for the words "color" and "colour" at the same time, you can use the search term colo*r.
translations.projectsDataDisclaimerLink: What information about projects does the service contain?
translations.noProjectLinks: The project has no links available in this portal {$INTERPOLATION}
translations.spStartYearTooltip: The start year of the project
translations.spEndYearTooltip: The end year of the project
translations.spObjectivesTooltip: Description of the objectives set for the project
translations.spParticipantsTooltip: Organizations and individuals participating in the project.
translations.spResultsTooltip: The results achieved by the project
translations.spHomePageTooltip: A website outside the research.fi service that contains more detailed information on the project.
translations.spFiltersStartYearTooltip: Limit search based on the start year of the project.
translations.spFiltersOrganizationTooltip: Limit search based on the organizations participating in the project.
translations.spFiltersKeywordsTooltip: Limit search based on the keywords in the project's information.
translations.projectsBetaDescription: The projects are research projects of research organizations. In the initial phase, the service contains project descriptions imported from the former Hankehaavi online directory. The project descriptions cannot be updated at the moment. At a later stage, the data will also be supplemented by research projects in other fields and more comprehensive descriptive information.
translations.highlightOpenAccessPublications: Highlight open access publications in your profile
translations.highlightOpenAccessPublicationsInfo: Highlighting moves open access publications to the top of your publication list. Publications found in the Research.fi service that are openly available are automatically marked with an Open Science label.
translations.automaticPublishingModalTitle: Do you want to enable automatic publishing?
translations.automaticPublishingAccountSettingsInfoTe: When this feature is enabled, changes made in data sources will automatically appear in your profile.
translations.automaticPublsihingInfoTextBullet1: The description of your research activities and some contact details are not included in automatic publishing.
translations.automaticPublishingIsPossible: Automatic publishing of information is now available
translations.automaticPublsihingInfoText1: Changes made in data sources can be automatically published on your profile.
translations.automaticPublishingCheckboxActiveAdditio: Since there are two data sources, some duplicates may appear in your profile, for example in the activity information. You can manually hide the duplicates in your profile.
translations.automaticPublishingShortDescription: You can enable new information related to you to be published automatically on your profile.
translations.automaticPublishingEnabledToast: Automatic publishing has been enabled and the changes have been saved to your account settings.
translations.automaticPublishingDisabledToast: Automatic publishing has been disabled and the changes have been saved to your account settings.
